Text:
I got here looking exactly for this feature, that is, being able to save edited `CSS` properties back to the original file (on my local development machine). Unfortunately after searching a lot and not finding anything that suits my needs (OK, there's [CSS Updater][1] but you have to register and it's a paid extension...) I gave up on Firefox + Firebug and looked for something similar for Google Chrome. Guess what... I just found this great post that shows a nice way of getting this to work:

[Change CSS and SAVE on local file system using Chrome Developer Tools][2]

I hope it helps if it doesn't matter to you changing browser while editing your CSS files. I made the change already for now, but I would really love to have this functionality built-in in Firebug. :)

  [1]: http://www.cssupdater.com/
  [2]: http://devcoma.blogspot.com.br/2012/07/change-css-and-save-on-local-file.html

I got here looking exactly for this feature, that is, being able to save edited `CSS` properties back to the original file (on my local development machine). Unfortunately after searching a lot and not finding anything that suits my needs (OK, there's [CSS Updater][1] but you have to register and it's a paid extension...) I gave up on Firefox + Firebug and looked for something similar for Google Chrome. Guess what... I just found this great post that shows a nice way of getting this to work:

[Change CSS and SAVE on local file system using Chrome Developer Tools][2]

I tried it now and it works great highlighting the changed lines. Just click Save and you're done! :)

I hope it helps if it doesn't matter to you changing browser while editing your CSS files. I made the change already for now, but I would really love to have this functionality built-in in Firebug. :)

  [1]: http://www.cssupdater.com/
  [2]: http://devcoma.blogspot.com.br/2012/07/change-css-and-save-on-local-file.html

Text:
I got here looking exactly for this feature, that is, being able to save edited `CSS` properties back to the original file (on my local development machine). Unfortunately after searching a lot and not finding anything that suits my needs (OK, there's [CSS Updater][1] but you have to register and it's a paid extension...) I gave up on Firefox + Firebug and looked for something similar for Google Chrome. Guess what... I just found this great post that shows a nice way of getting this to work ( built into Chrome - there's no need for additional extensions ):

[Change CSS and SAVE on local file system using Chrome Developer Tools][2]

![enter image description here][3]

I tried it now and it works great highlighting the changed lines. Just click Save and you're done! :)

Here's a video explaining this and much more: [Google I/O 2011: Chrome Dev Tools Reloaded][4]

I hope it helps if it doesn't matter to you changing browser while editing your CSS files. I made the change already for now, but I would really love to have this functionality built into Firebug. :)


  [1]: http://www.cssupdater.com/
  [2]: http://devcoma.blogspot.com.br/2012/07/change-css-and-save-on-local-file.html
  [3]: http://i.stack.imgur.com/6gwkI.png
  [4]: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=N8SS-rUEZPg&feature=player_detailpage#t=515s

I got here looking exactly for this feature, that is, being able to save edited `CSS` properties back to the original file (on my local development machine). Unfortunately after searching a lot and not finding anything that suits my needs (OK, there's [CSS Updater][1] but you have to register and it's a paid extension...) I gave up on Firefox + Firebug and looked for something similar for Google Chrome. Guess what... I just found this great post that shows a nice way of getting this to work ( built into Chrome - there's no need for additional extensions ):

[Change CSS and SAVE on local file system using Chrome Developer Tools][2]

![enter image description here][3]

I tried it now and it works great highlighting the changed lines. Just click Save and you're done! :)

Here's a video explaining this and much more: [Google I/O 2011: Chrome Dev Tools Reloaded][4]

I hope it helps if it doesn't matter to you changing browser while editing your CSS files. I made the change already for now, but I would really love to have this functionality built into Firebug. :)


----------


**[Update]**

Today I just saw this video: [Firefox CSS live edit in Sublimetext (work in progress)][5] Looks promising indeed.

  [4]: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=N8SS-rUEZPg&feature=player_detailpage#t=515s
  [5]: http://youtu.be/UrnB8lZnx4I

**[Update 1]**

Today I just saw this video: [Firefox CSS live edit in Sublimetext (work in progress)][5] Looks promising indeed.

**[Update 2]**

If you happen to be using [Visual Studio 2013][6] with [Web Essentials][7] you'll be able to sync CSS automagically as shown in this video:

[Web Essentials: Browser tools integration][8]
